column39: 2.4 How often do you use the following ways to get information about users?: I remotely observe users when they are using the software (e.g., screen sharing)

column46: 3.1 Does your company conduct experiments involving the users?:
column47: 3.2 Please describe a typical experiment you have seen or been involved in in your company, including the roles. (Skip this if you have not seen or been involved in any experiments.)
column48: For understanding user needs better...: Data should always be collected because it might be needed later
column49: For understanding user needs better...: Data should only be collected when there is a known need or assumption
column50: For understanding user needs better...: Rich, detailed data about what users do is useful
column51: For understanding user needs better...: Focused data on a specific user action or behaviour is useful
column52: For understanding user needs better...: Users themselves must be actively involved in shaping the software
column53: For understanding user needs better...: We need to measure user behaviour to decide what the software should be like
column54: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users do not need to know they are involved
column55: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: If we collect personal information, users need to be notified
column56: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: If no laws are being broken, users do not need to be notified
column57: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users can be involved in an experiment without their knowledge if we let them know afterwards
column58: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users should always be notified when they are being involved in an experiment
column59: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: It is ok not to disclose all the experiment details to users involved
column60: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: It is ok to trick the user if the validity of experiment results depend on it
column61: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: I cannot trust that the results will be correct
column62: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Involving users in experiments is time-consuming
column63: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Our company does not have the needed technical infrastructure
column64: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users would not like to be part of software experiments
column65: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users have to be convinced of the benefit before taking part
column66: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments give users false expectations
column67: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments reveal secrets about the product strategy
